intro: Machaeranthera setigera, commonly known as the prairie blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in prairie and open woodland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its showy yellow to orange flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. The species is known for its ornamental value and ecological importance in supporting native pollinator populations.
